register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: IP Revision

Configuration of the local initiator state management mode. By definition, initiator may generate read/write transaction as long as it is out of STANDBY state. 0x0 FORCE Force-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed in standby state. Backup mode, for debug only. 0x1 NO No-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed out of standby state. Backup mode, for debug only. 0x2 SMART Smart-standby mode: local initiator standby status depends on local conditions, i.e. the module's functional requirement from the initiator.
Reports '1' if SCS feature is supported by LDC.
Enables expanded format of affine warp coefficients (A, B, D, and E). 0: A, B, D, E are treated as S14Q12 1: A, B, D, E are treated as S16Q12
Enables circular addressing mode. 0 - Disable circular addressing for input data. 1 - Enable circular addressing.
Enable/Disable smart codec statistic (SCS) function. 0 - Disable SCS 1 - Enable SCS
Enable perspective warp transform. Set to 1 to enable use ofLDC_GH[15:0] G and LDC_GH[31:16] H.
Bayer data format (only applicable when MODE=1). 3: A-law data in/out, 2: Packed 8-bit data in/out, 1: Packed 12-bit data in/out, 0: Unpacked 12-bit data in/out
2: YCbCr 4:2:0 Lens Distortion, 1: Bayer chromatic aberration mode, 0: YCbCr 4:2:2 Lens Distortion
Idle/busy status, 0: Idle, 1: Busy, asserted when function is started, cleared when function is complete
LD Mapping Enable, 1: Enabled, 0: Disabled
Write 1 to start the function, as specified in MODE
Read frame base, must be 16-byte aligned so internally [3:0] bits are hard-wired zero.
Sets the circular buffer size if circular buffering mode is used. The circular buffer is sized in terms of number of rows.
Read frame line offset, must be 16-byte aligned so internally [3:0] bits are hard-wired zero.
Frame number of lines
Frame width
Output starting Y-coordinate (must be even)
Output starting X-coordiinate (must be even)
Write frame base, must be 16-byte aligned so internally [3:0] bits are hard-wired zero.
Write frame line offset, must be 16-byte aligned so internally [3:0] bits are hard-wired zero.

register.description: Define number of regions and output divider for region based statistics.

bitfield.description: Sets the number of output lines computed by LDC before the computed macroblock row statistics are transferred to system memory. This must be a multiple of 16 so bits [19:16] are internally fixed to zero. The maximum possible value is 8176 (0x1FF0).
Sets the number of regions in both directions for the region based statistics. Possible values: 0 - 1x1 1 - 2x2 2 - 3x3 3 - 4x4
Sets the output divider for sum of pixels in a region and sum of squares of pixels in a region. This parameter right shifts the final accumulator prior to writing the output statistics.
